lines.meaning: The Thousand Names of Lord Vishnu
lines.note: The Vishnu Sahasranama is a sacred hymn containing 1000 names of Lord Vishnu, found in the Anushasana Parva of the Mahabharata. It was revealed by the grandsire Bhishma to Yudhishthira while lying on a bed of arrows after the great war. This stotra is considered one of the most powerful and comprehensive hymns in Hindu tradition, encompassing the full glory of the Supreme Being.

lines.meaning: Om! (I meditate upon) the one clad in white garments, the all-pervading Vishnu, who is moon-complexioned and has four arms...

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: One who wears white/pure garments
One whose complexion is like the moon (luminous, fair)
One who has four arms

lines.note: This is the Ganesha Dhyana Shloka, traditionally recited before beginning any sacred text. Though it describes Vishnu's form, it is addressed to Ganesha who removes all obstacles. The white garment and moon complexion describe the form of Mahaganapati.

lines.meaning: One should meditate upon Him with a serene, pleasant countenance for the complete pacification of all obstacles.

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: One with a serene, pleasant face
For the complete removal of all obstacles

lines.note: This is the second half of the Ganesha Dhyana Shloka, traditionally recited before beginning any sacred text to invoke blessings for removing obstacles.

lines.meaning: He whose attendants, beginning with the elephant-faced one (Ganesha), number more than a hundred...

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: Beginning with the elephant-faced one (Ganesha) and others
Attendants, members of the divine assembly

lines.note: This is the first half of the Vishvaksena Dhyana Shloka. Vishvaksena is the commander of Vishnu's army and is invoked before the Sahasranama.

lines.meaning: ...who constantly destroy all obstacles - I take refuge in that Vishvaksena.

etymology.dhatu: विष्वक् (viṣvak - in all directions) + सेना (sēnā - army)
etymology.meaning: One whose army extends in all directions; Commander-in-chief of Vishnu's divine forces

namaAnalysis.note: Vishvaksena is the general of Vishnu's divine army. In Vaishnava tradition, he is worshipped before any auspicious activity, similar to Ganesha in other traditions.

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: One whose army extends in all directions

lines.meaning: Preliminary Introduction
lines.note: The Poorva Peetika (Preliminary Section) contains the invocations, the setting of the dialogue between Yudhishthira and Bhishma, and the six questions that Bhishma answers with the Sahasranama.

lines.meaning: (I salute) Vyasa, great-grandson of Vasishtha, grandson of Shakti, who is pure and sinless...

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: Great-grandson of Sage Vasishtha
Pure, without any blemish or sin

lines.note: Vyasa's lineage: Vasishtha → Shakti → Parashara → Vyasa. This verse establishes the illustrious lineage of the compiler of the Mahabharata.

lines.meaning: ...I bow to the son of Parashara, the father of Shuka, who is a treasure-house of austerity.

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: Son of Sage Parashara
Father of Sage Shuka
Treasury of austerity; one who has amassed great tapas

lines.note: Sage Shuka (Shukadeva) was Vyasa's illustrious son who narrated the Bhagavata Purana to King Parikshit.

lines.meaning: To Vyasa who is a form of Vishnu, and to Vishnu who has taken the form of Vyasa...

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: To one who has the form of Vishnu
To one who has taken the form of Vyasa

lines.note: This verse establishes the identity of Vyasa with Vishnu. Vyasa is considered an avatara (incarnation) of Vishnu who descended to compile and divide the Vedas.

lines.deva: नमो वै ब्रह्मनिधये वासिष्ठाय नमो नमः ॥
lines.iast: namō vai brahmanidhayē vāsiṣṭhāya namō namaḥ ॥
lines.knda: ನಮೋ ವೈ ಬ್ರಹ್ಮನಿಧಯೇ ವಾಸಿಷ್ಠಾಯ ನಮೋ ನಮಃ ॥
lines.tel: నమో వై బ్రహ్మనిధయే వాసిష్ఠాయ నమో నమః ॥
lines.tam: நமோ வை ப்³ரஹ்மனித⁴யே வாஸிஷ்டா²ய நமோ நம: ॥
lines.guj: નમો વૈ બ્રહ્મનિધયે વાસિષ્ઠાય નમો નમઃ ॥
lines.pan: ਨਮੋ ਵੈ ਬ੍ਰਹ੍ਮਨਿਧਯੇ ਵਾਸਿਸ਼੍ਠਾਯ ਨਮੋ ਨਮਃ ॥
lines.mr: नमो वै ब्रह्मनिधये वासिष्ठाय नमो नमः ॥
lines.meaning: ...salutations to the treasure-house of Vedic knowledge (Brahman), to the descendant of Vasishtha, salutations again and again!

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: To the treasury of Vedic/Brahman knowledge
To the descendant of the Vasishtha lineage

lines.meaning: To the unchanging One, the pure One, the eternal One, the Supreme Self...

etymology.meaning: Pure; untainted; free from all impurities

etymology.dhatu: नि (ni) + इ (i - to go) - that which always exists

etymology.meaning: The Supreme Self; the highest Soul

lines.meaning: ...to the One of eternally uniform form, to Vishnu, the all-conquering One!

etymology.dhatu: सदा (sadā - always) + एक (eka - one) + रूप (rūpa - form)
etymology.meaning: One whose form is eternally the same; unchanging in appearance
The all-pervading One; One who enters and permeates everything

etymology.dhatu: सर्व (sarva - all) + जि (ji - to conquer) + ष्णु (ṣṇu - suffix)

lines.meaning: By merely remembering whom, from the bondage of birth and worldly existence...

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: By mere remembrance alone
From the bondage of birth and the cycle of worldly existence

lines.note: This is the famous verse proclaiming the power of simply remembering Vishnu's name - the foundation of Nama Japa.

lines.meaning: ...one is liberated - salutations to that Vishnu, the Lord of all beings!

etymology.meaning: The origin of all beings; the all-powerful Lord; the source of creation

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: One is completely liberated/freed

lines.meaning: Om! Salutations to Vishnu, the origin and lord of all beings!
lines.note: This mantra is the essential invocation before beginning the Sahasranama. Om represents the primordial sound from which all creation emerges.

lines.meaning: Sri Vaishampayana said:
lines.note: Vaishampayana was a disciple of Vyasa who narrated the Mahabharata to King Janamejaya during the Sarpa Satra (snake sacrifice). This sets the narrative frame.

lines.deva: श्रुत्वा धर्मा नशेषेण पावनानि च सर्वशः ।
lines.iast: śrutvā dharmā naśēṣēṇa pāvanāni cha sarvaśaḥ ।
lines.knda: ಶ್ರುತ್ವಾ ಧರ್ಮಾ ನಶೇಷೇಣ ಪಾವನಾನಿ ಚ ಸರ್ವಶಃ ।
lines.tel: శ్రుత్వా ధర్మా నశేషేణ పావనాని చ సర్వశః ।
lines.tam: ஶ்ருத்வா த⁴ர்மா நஶேஷேண பாவனானி ச ஸர்வஶ: ।
lines.guj: શ્રુત્વા ધર્મા નશેષેણ પાવનાનિ ચ સર્વશઃ ।
lines.pan: ਸ਼੍ਰੁਤ੍ਵਾ ਧਰ੍ਮਾ ਨਸ਼ੇਸ਼ੇਣ ਪਾਵਨਾਨਿ ਚ ਸਰ੍ਵਸ਼ਃ ।
lines.mr: श्रुत्वा धर्मा नशेषेण पावनानि च सर्वशः ।
lines.meaning: Having heard all the dharmas completely, and all the purifying practices...

lines.ben: শ্রুত্বা ধর্মা নশেষেণ পাবনানি চ সর্বশঃ ।
lines.mal: ശ്രുത്വാ ധര്മാ നശേഷേണ പാവനാനി ച സർവശഃ ।
lines.meaning: ...Yudhishthira again addressed the son of Shantanu (Bhishma).

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: Son of Shantanu (i.e., Bhishma)

lines.note: Bhishma, the great patriarch, lies on a bed of arrows after the Kurukshetra war, waiting for an auspicious moment to depart. Yudhishthira approaches him for final instructions.

lines.meaning: Yudhishthira said:
lines.note: Yudhishthira, the eldest Pandava known as Dharmaraja, poses six profound questions to Bhishma that form the basis of the entire Sahasranama.

lines.deva: किमेकं दैवतं लोके किं वाऽप्येकं परायणं
lines.iast: kimēkaṃ daivataṃ lōkē kiṃ vā'pyēkaṃ parāyaṇaṃ
lines.knda: ಕಿಮೇಕಂ ದೈವತಂ ಲೋಕೇ ಕಿಂ ವಾಽಪ್ಯೇಕಂ ಪರಾಯಣಂ
lines.tel: కిమేకం దైవతం లోకే కిం వాఽప్యేకం పరాయణం
lines.tam: கிமேகம் தை³வதம் லோகே கிம் வாப்யேகம் பராயணம்
lines.guj: કિમેકં દૈવતં લોકે કિં વાઽપ્યેકં પરાયણં
lines.pan: ਕਿਮੇਕਂ ਦੈਵਤਂ ਲੋਕੇ ਕਿਂ ਵਾ਽ਪ੍ਯੇਕਂ ਪਰਾਯਣਂ
lines.mr: किमेकं दैवतं लोके किं वाऽप्येकं परायणं
lines.meaning: Who is the One Supreme Deity in the world? Who is the One ultimate refuge?
lines.note: Questions 1 & 2: These are the first of six profound questions Yudhishthira asks Bhishma. They seek to identify the supreme object of worship and the ultimate goal of life.

lines.ben: কিমেকং দৈবতং লোকে কিং বাঽপ্য়েকং পরাযণং
lines.mal: കിമേകം ദൈവതം ലോകേ കിം വാഽപ്യേകം പരായണം
lines.meaning: By praising whom, by worshipping whom, can human beings attain auspiciousness (good fortune)?
lines.note: Questions 3 & 4: These questions ask about the practical means - through praise (stuti) and worship (archana) - by which humans can attain the highest good.

lines.deva: को धर्मः सर्वधर्माणां भवतः परमो मतः ।
lines.iast: kō dharmaḥ sarvadharmāṇāṃ bhavataḥ paramō mataḥ ।
lines.knda: ಕೋ ಧರ್ಮಃ ಸರ್ವಧರ್ಮಾಣಾಂ ಭವತಃ ಪರಮೋ ಮತಃ ।
lines.tel: కో ధర్మః సర్వధర్మాణాం భవతః పరమో మతః ।
lines.tam: கோ த⁴ர்ம: ஸர்வத⁴ர்மாணாம் ப⁴வத: பரமோ மத: ।
lines.guj: કો ધર્મઃ સર્વધર્માણાં ભવતઃ પરમો મતઃ ।
lines.pan: ਕੋ ਧਰ੍ਮਃ ਸਰ੍ਵਧਰ੍ਮਾਣਾਂ ਭਵਤਃ ਪਰਮੋ ਮਤਃ ।
lines.mr: को धर्मः सर्वधर्माणां भवतः परमो मतः ।
lines.meaning: Which dharma (righteous practice) is, in your opinion, the supreme among all dharmas?
lines.note: Question 5: This asks for the essence of all religious and moral duties - the one practice that encompasses all others.

lines.ben: কো ধর্মঃ সর্বধর্মাণাং ভবতঃ পরমো মতঃ ।
lines.mal: കോ ധര്മഃ സർവധര്മാണാം ഭവതഃ പരമോ മതഃ ।
lines.meaning: By chanting what (mantra/name) can a living being be freed from the bondage of birth and worldly existence?

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: From the bondage of birth and the cycle of worldly existence (samsara)

lines.note: Question 6: The final and most crucial question - what is the supreme mantra or name that grants liberation (moksha)? Bhishma's answer to all six questions is the Vishnu Sahasranama.

lines.meaning: Shri Bhishma said
lines.note: This marks the beginning of Bhishma's answer to Yudhishthira's six questions. Bhishma, the grandsire of the Kuru dynasty, was a great devotee of Vishnu and possessed the boon of choosing his own time of death (ichcha mrityu). He delivers this sacred teaching while lying on his deathbed of arrows.

lines.meaning: The Lord of the universe, the God of gods, the Infinite One, the Supreme Being (Purushottama)...

samasaVibhaga.combinedMeaning: The Lord of the universe
God of gods (the supreme deity)
The Supreme Being, highest among all beings

lines.meaning: By praising with the thousand names, a person who is constantly uplifted (in devotion)...
lines.note: Bhishma begins his answer by describing the method and benefits of reciting the Sahasranama. The term 'satatotthita' indicates one who is ever alert and devoted.

lines.meaning: Worshipping Him alone daily with devotion, the Imperishable Being...
Meditating, praising, bowing, and worshipping Him alone...
Vishnu who is without beginning or end, the great Lord of all worlds...
By always praising the Lord of worlds, one transcends all sorrows.

lines.deva: ब्रह्मण्यं सर्व धर्मज्ञं लोकानां कीर्ति वर्धनम् ।
lines.iast: brahmaṇyaṃ sarva dharmajñaṃ lōkānāṃ kīrti vardhanam ।
lines.knda: ಬ್ರಹ್ಮಣ್ಯಂ ಸರ್ವ ಧರ್ಮಜ್ಞಂ ಲೋಕಾನಾಂ ಕೀರ್ತಿ ವರ್ಧನಮ್ ।
lines.tel: బ్రహ్మణ్యం సర్వ ధర్మజ్ఞం లోకానాం కీర్తి వర్ధనమ్ ।
lines.tam: ப்³ரஹ்மண்யம் ஸர்வ த⁴ர்மஜ்ஞம் லோகானாம் கீர்தி வர்த⁴னம் ।
lines.guj: બ્રહ્મણ્યં સર્વ ધર્મજ્ઞં લોકાનાં કીર્તિ વર્ધનમ્ ।
lines.pan: ਬ੍ਰਹ੍ਮਣ੍ਯਂ ਸਰ੍ਵ ਧਰ੍ਮਜ੍ਞਂ ਲੋਕਾਨਾਂ ਕੀਰ੍ਤਿ ਵਰ੍ਧਨਮ੍ ।
lines.mr: ब्रह्मण्यं सर्व धर्मज्ञं लोकानां कीर्ति वर्धनम् ।
lines.meaning: The supporter of Brahmins, knower of all dharma, enhancer of the glory of all beings...

lines.ben: ব্রহ্মণ্য়ং সর্ব ধর্মজ্ঞং লোকানাং কীর্তি বর্ধনম্ ।
lines.mal: ബ്രഹ്മണ്യം സർവ ധര്മജ്ഞം ലോകാനാം കീര്തി വര്ധനമ് ।
lines.meaning: The Lord of worlds, the Great Being, the source and origin of all creatures.

lines.deva: एष मे सर्व धर्माणां धर्मोऽधिक तमोमतः ।
lines.iast: ēṣa mē sarva dharmāṇāṃ dharmō'dhika tamōmataḥ ।
lines.knda: ಏಷ ಮೇ ಸರ್ವ ಧರ್ಮಾಣಾಂ ಧರ್ಮೋಽಧಿಕ ತಮೋಮತಃ ।
lines.tel: ఏష మే సర్వ ధర్మాణాం ధర్మోఽధిక తమోమతః ।
lines.tam: ஏஷ மே ஸர்வ த⁴ர்மாணாம் த⁴ர்மோதி⁴க தமோமத: ।
lines.guj: એષ મે સર્વ ધર્માણાં ધર્મોઽધિક તમોમતઃ ।
lines.pan: ਏਸ਼ ਮੇ ਸਰ੍ਵ ਧਰ੍ਮਾਣਾਂ ਧਰ੍ਮੋ਽ਧਿਕ ਤਮੋਮਤਃ ।
lines.mr: एष मे सर्व धर्माणां धर्मोऽधिक तमोमतः ।
lines.meaning: This, in my opinion, is the highest dharma of all dharmas...

lines.ben: এষ মে সর্ব ধর্মাণাং ধর্মোঽধিক তমোমতঃ ।
lines.mal: ഏഷ മേ സർവ ധര്മാണാം ധര്മോഽധിക തമോമതഃ ।
lines.meaning: That a person who always worships the lotus-eyed One (Pundarikaksha) with devotion and hymns...

lines.deva: परमं यो महत्तेजः परमं यो महत्तपः ।
lines.iast: paramaṃ yō mahattējaḥ paramaṃ yō mahattapaḥ ।
lines.knda: ಪರಮಂ ಯೋ ಮಹತ್ತೇಜಃ ಪರಮಂ ಯೋ ಮಹತ್ತಪಃ ।
lines.tel: పరమం యో మహత్తేజః పరమం యో మహత్తపః ।
lines.tam: பரமம் யோ மஹத்தேஜ: பரமம் யோ மஹத்தப: ।
lines.guj: પરમં યો મહત્તેજઃ પરમં યો મહત્તપઃ ।
lines.pan: ਪਰਮਂ ਯੋ ਮਹਤ੍ਤੇਜਃ ਪਰਮਂ ਯੋ ਮਹਤ੍ਤਪਃ ।
lines.mr: परमं यो महत्तेजः परमं यो महत्तपः ।
lines.meaning: He who is the supreme radiance, the supreme austerity...

lines.deva: परमं यो महद्ब्रह्म परमं यः परायणम् ।
lines.iast: paramaṃ yō mahadbrahma paramaṃ yaḥ parāyaṇam ।
lines.knda: ಪರಮಂ ಯೋ ಮಹದ್ಬ್ರಹ್ಮ ಪರಮಂ ಯಃ ಪರಾಯಣಮ್ ।
lines.tel: పరమం యో మహద్బ్రహ్మ పరమం యః పరాయణమ్ ।
lines.tam: பரமம் யோ மஹத்³ப்³ரஹ்ம பரமம் ய: பராயணம் ।
lines.guj: પરમં યો મહદ્બ્રહ્મ પરમં યઃ પરાયણમ્ ।
lines.pan: ਪਰਮਂ ਯੋ ਮਹਦ੍ਬ੍ਰਹ੍ਮ ਪਰਮਂ ਯਃ ਪਰਾਯਣਮ੍ ।
lines.mr: परमं यो महद्ब्रह्म परमं यः परायणम् ।
lines.ben: পরমং যো মহত্তেজঃ পরমং যো মহত্তপঃ ।
lines.mal: പരമം യോ മഹത്തേജഃ പരമം യോ മഹത്തപഃ ।
lines.meaning: He who is the Supreme Brahman, the ultimate refuge...

lines.deva: पवित्राणां पवित्रं यो मङ्गलानां च मङ्गलम् ।
lines.iast: pavitrāṇāṃ pavitraṃ yō maṅgaḻānāṃ cha maṅgaḻam ।
lines.knda: ಪವಿತ್ರಾಣಾಂ ಪವಿತ್ರಂ ಯೋ ಮಂಗಳಾನಾಂ ಚ ಮಂಗಳಮ್ ।
lines.tel: పవిత్రాణాం పవిత్రం యో మంగళానాం చ మంగళమ్ ।
lines.tam: பவித்ராணாம் பவித்ரம் யோ மங்கள³ானாம் ச மங்கள³ம் ।
lines.guj: પવિત્રાણાં પવિત્રં યો મંગળાનાં ચ મંગળમ્ ।
lines.pan: ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰਾਣਾਂ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰਂ ਯੋ ਮਂਗਲ਼ਾਨਾਂ ਚ ਮਂਗਲ਼ਮ੍ ।
lines.mr: पवित्राणां पवित्रं यो मंगलानां च मंगलम् ।
lines.meaning: He who is the purest of the pure, the most auspicious of all auspicious things...

lines.deva: दैवतं देवतानां च भूतानां योऽव्ययः पिता ॥
lines.iast: daivataṃ dēvatānāṃ cha bhūtānāṃ yō'vyayaḥ pitā ॥
lines.knda: ದೈವತಂ ದೇವತಾನಾಂ ಚ ಭೂತಾನಾಂ ಯೋಽವ್ಯಯಃ ಪಿತಾ ॥
lines.tel: దైవతం దేవతానాం చ భూతానాం యోఽవ్యయః పితా ॥
lines.tam: தை³வதம் தே³வதானாம் ச பூ⁴தானாம் யோவ்யய: பிதா ॥
lines.guj: દૈવતં દેવતાનાં ચ ભૂતાનાં યોઽવ્યયઃ પિતા ॥
lines.pan: ਦੈਵਤਂ ਦੇਵਤਾਨਾਂ ਚ ਭੂਤਾਨਾਂ ਯੋ਽ਵ੍ਯਯਃ ਪਿਤਾ ॥
lines.mr: दैवतं देवतानां च भूतानां योऽव्ययः पिता ॥
lines.ben: পবিত্রাণাং পবিত্রং যো মংগলানাং চ মংগলম্ ।
lines.mal: പവിത്രാണാം പവിത്രം യോ മംഗളാനാം ച മംഗളമ് ।
lines.meaning: The God of gods, the imperishable Father of all beings.
From whom all beings arise at the beginning of the cosmic cycle...
And into whom they dissolve again at the end of each cosmic age.
Of that primordial Lord of the worlds, of Jagannatha, O King...

lines.deva: विष्णोर्नाम सहस्रं मे श्रुणु पाप भयापहम् ॥
lines.iast: viṣṇōrnāma sahasraṃ mē śruṇu pāpa bhayāpaham ॥
lines.knda: ವಿಷ್ಣೋರ್ನಾಮ ಸಹಸ್ರಂ ಮೇ ಶ್ರುಣು ಪಾಪ ಭಯಾಪಹಮ್ ॥
lines.tel: విష్ణోర్నామ సహస్రం మే శ్రుణు పాప భయాపహమ్ ॥
lines.tam: விஷ்ணோர்னாம ஸஹஸ்ரம் மே ஶ்ருணு பாப ப⁴யாபஹம் ॥
lines.guj: વિષ્ણોર્નામ સહસ્રં મે શ્રુણુ પાપ ભયાપહમ્ ॥
lines.pan: ਵਿਸ਼੍ਣੋਰ੍ਨਾਮ ਸਹਸ੍ਰਂ ਮੇ ਸ਼੍ਰੁਣੁ ਪਾਪ ਭਯਾਪਹਮ੍ ॥
lines.mr: विष्णोर्नाम सहस्रं मे श्रुणु पाप भयापहम् ॥
lines.meaning: Hear from me the thousand names of Vishnu, which destroy sin and fear.
lines.note: This is a pivotal verse where Bhishma formally introduces the Sahasranama. He promises Yudhishthira that these names will remove all sins and fears.

lines.meaning: Those famous names of the Great Soul that are based on His attributes...
Which have been sung by the sages - these I shall recite for your welfare.
The Rishi of the thousand names is the great sage Veda Vyasa.
lines.note: This begins the viniyoga (application) portion that identifies the spiritual components of the stotra for ritual purposes.

lines.meaning: The meter (chandas) is Anushtup; the deity is the Lord, the son of Devaki (Krishna).
The bija (seed mantra) is 'Amritam Shudbhava'; the shakti (power) is Devaki-nandana (Krishna).
Trisama is the heart (hridayam) of this stotra; it is recited for peace and auspiciousness.
Vishnu, the Victorious, the Great Vishnu, the Powerful, the Great Lord...
I bow to the Supreme Being (Purushottama), who has many forms and who destroys demons.
lines.note: This concluding verse of the Poorva Peetika prepares for the main recitation. The devotee offers salutations to Vishnu who manifests in countless forms to protect dharma.
